original: Lundberg, Ernst Magnus, rektor, Vänersborg, f. 2/3/82 i Landskrona av J. L. o. Johanna Andersson. G. 10 m. Lilly Wallgren. Barn: Erik f. 11, Allan 13, Per Olov 31. — Mog:ex. i Hälsingborg 00, fil. kand. i Lund 03, fil. lic. 09, fil. dr 12, provår 09. Res. t. Tyskl. o. Österr. 13, Tyskl. 28, Danm. o. Norge uppr. ggr. Lär. v. Eslövs ensk. elem:sk. 02-04, Lunds priv. ele-m:sk. 07-08, Landskrona gymn. 09-10, adj. v. Malmö h. a. 1. 09, lektor i fysik o. matem. i Härnösand 13, i Jönköp. fr. 19, rektor f. Vänersborgs h. a. 1. 19-47. Medl. av Härnösands domkap. 14-17, aman. där 16-17, suppl. i Härnös. byggn:nd 16-18 o. rev. f. stadens räkensk. 16-17, led. av styr. f. Vänersb. mus. sed. 19, dess ordf. fr. 41, ordf. i styr. f. Vänersb. h. flicklä-rov. 20-22, insp. f. dets. 29-33, f. Arb :-fören. föreläsn :anst. fr. 20, led. av ’stadsfullm. (h) sed. 21, dess v. ordf. sed. 43, led. av drätselkamm. 30-34, dess ordf. 35, v. ordf. eller ordf. i lö-neavtalsndn 30-44, led. av styr. f. folkbibi. 31-35, ordf. i styr. f. Sparb. samt Ränte- o. kap :försäkr :anst. i Vänersb. sed. 36, i styr. f. Sv:es komm:anst. pens :kassa sed. 38, led. av direkt, f. Restads o. Källshagens sjukh. sed. 39, led. av styr. f. dövstumsk. i Vänersb. sed. 42, ordf. sed. 46, led. av kulturminnesrådet f. Älvsb. 1. sed. 45. Skr.: Om par av applicabla ytor (gradiavh. 12). RNO.
translated: Lundberg, Ernst Magnus, principal, Vänersborg, born on March 2, 1882 in Landskrona to J. L. and Johanna Andersson. Married to Lilly Wallgren for 10 years. Children: Erik, born in 1911, Allan, born in 1913, Per Olov, born in 1931. Completed the teacher's examination in Hälsingborg in 1900, Bachelor of Arts in Lund in 1903, licensed in 1909, obtained a doctorate in 1912, probationary year in 1909. Traveled to Germany and Austria in 1913, Germany in 1928, and several times to Denmark and Norway. Taught at Eslövs private elementary school from 1902-1904, Lund's private elementary school from 1907-1908, Landskrona gymnasium from 1909-1910, assistant teacher at Malmö high school from 1909, physics and mathematics lecturer in Härnösand from 1913, in Jönköping from 1919, principal of Vänersborg high school from 1919-1947. Member of Härnösand cathedral chapter from 1914-1917, assistant there from 1916-1917, substitute in Härnösand building committee from 1916-1918 and auditor for the city's accounting from 1916-1917, member of the board of Vänersborg museum since 1919, chairman since 1941, chairman of the board of Vänersborg girls' high school from 1920-1922, inspector from 1929-1933, founder of the Workers' Association lecture institute from 1920, member of the city council (conservative) since 1921, vice chairman since 1943, member of the finance committee from 1930-1934, chairman since 1935, vice chairman or chairman of the wage agreement committee from 1930-1944, member of the board of the public library from 1931-1935, chairman of the board of the Savings Bank and Interest and Capital Insurance Institution in Vänersborg since 1936, in the board of the Swedish public employees' pension fund since 1938, member of the board of directors of Restad and Källshagen hospital since 1939, member of the board of the deaf and dumb school in Vänersborg since 1942, chairman since 1946, member of the cultural heritage council for Älvsborg County since 1945. Written work: On pairs of applicable surfaces (doctoral thesis, 1912). Recipient of the Illustrious Order of the North Star.

awards.name: Royal Order of the North Star
